Reviews.Title: Chromo Inc 7" Black Android 4.0 Tablet
Reviews.Author: Gregory S. Luff
Reviews.Content: Over the past few years I have refrained form joining the tablet revolution because I already have so many digital electronic devices in my possession.  IE: 2 Android smartphones, pda, 2 digital cameras, 3 laptop pcs, just to name a few offhand.However, when this tablet caught my eye, I decided to try one, especially taking into account the price and features.Since this tablet has a limited internal memory (4 GB) I also purchased a 16 GB micro SD Card to push the capacity to 20 GB.So far I have been completely satisfied with its' overall performance. Remember, this is my first tablet!I like the fact that it does not require a contract since I mainly use it at home or at work, where I can use the Wi Fi connection.  I have also found it can be tethered to my smartsphone to access the Internet.  Took me a while to figure that one out, but it is possible!  Just use Google to find out how.The only downside I can see is the life of the battery (2-3 hrs).  But I knew this beforehand, so I always have one or two chargers with me.  It can be charged either with the plug in charger included with the tablet or with the same micro USB charger for my phone.  So, for me, this does not pose a problem.Yes, it may be slower than other higher priced tablets, but it does perform exactly as described.In fact, a few days after purchasing one for myself, I ended up purchasing another for my partner who has experienced the same results a myself.Overall we both are completely satisfied with this product.  I have rated it with 4 stars out of 5 simply because I have not had it long enough to give it 5.  This does not in any way mean it does not deserve 5 stars, I just have to use it more!Give it a try, you will be surprised how easy it is to use.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: Eric Christopher
Reviews.Content: Are these those most powerful tablets on the market ?noDo they have the best picture?nobut for this price these tablets are fantastic.  I bought these for both my kids for christmas? Like every parent I was worried about buying a $400 tablet to put into my childs care.  Both of my kids are fairly responsible for their age, but still. then I came across this tablet.  these tablet has been great for everything my kids have thrown at it. the youngest is mostly games, but my oldest does email, netflix, hulu, youtube and a bunch of games and this powers through them all.so sure you can find more powerful better looking tablets out there, but if you are looking for a cheap, well built, tablet this one does it thing,oh one last thing battery lift I know that is everyones first concern,  My son will crush this battery in about an hour to and hour and half. but that is straight play, no break, cut the rope marathons. then he plugs it in and about 2 hours later battery is fully charged and he is back at it.  so for me with the amount of work he puts it through the battery does pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic tablet
Reviews.Author: GadgetGirl

Reviews.Title: Better than expected from generic tablet and generic complaints.
Reviews.Author: Hind Batal
Reviews.Content: I was really worried getting this because ipad wannabes tend to be awful. The tablet worked just fine out of the box with a 35% pre charge. The first thing I tested out was how responsive it is. Surprisingly, it is actually pretty fast. A lot faster than I expected. Apps downloaded fast. I got all of the major social networking apps downloaded in a few seconds, complex games took a bit longer. Its all integrated with Google (insert long sign) but the app store has a lot of options. I inserted more memory via a memory card.  So far so good, but I did buy the warranty just in case. I'll update if anything else happens.

Reviews.Title: happy custumer
Reviews.Author: John Lippello
Reviews.Content: we had ordered 2 of these and they work great .i had an issue with one of them ,and after a email or two the problem is being taken care of

Reviews.Title: I like this product.
Reviews.Author: Janet Emory
Reviews.Content: This tablet is very nice. I like the size and can carry it anywhere, and be online in a few seconds. I am not a very technical person, and this is a very easy to use tablet.  I would recommend it to anyone!  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Good Value, but a Button Wasn't Working
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tablet offers decent functionality for the price. You can connect to Google Play Store to download the latest apps, which is a huge plus for a tablet in this price range. I had to send mine back because the "volume down" button on the side of the device did not work. The seller was very prompt in issuing a refund, and I appreciate that.This unit would be better if it had more RAM. It's good for light duty reading and casual gaming, but it does bog down easily.

Reviews.Title: good function for relatively cheap price
Reviews.Author: jindal
Reviews.Content: good function for relatively cheap price for my 4 years old son, he likes it  very much! and we can download lots of apps from google.

Reviews.Title: Excelent buy
Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: Well in my opinion this tablet is very useful and versatile, in the past I used to think that buying tablets is a waste of money but this tablet definitely change my mind.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Stabby "Arson"
Reviews.Content: The only knock I have is that it is slow.  Other than that, great for the money.  Use for my 4 year old, would not work for me.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Joni Landmesser
Reviews.Content: I bought these for my 11 grandkids for Christmas.  They were thrilled.  Within an hour we had all the kids up and running.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: K Clagett
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for a Christmas present after the decent reviews. I have had it 3 weeks and has been freezing up. Now it is black screen and will not reboot like so many other posts from the end of December forward. I will be returning mine tomorrow when UPS opens.

Reviews.Title: Enable HDMI with correct cable.
Reviews.Author: LeoSr
Reviews.Content: I wanted to enable the HDMI port to project/play downloaded videos to my bigger TV screen.  Following the user manual, I bought a micro-hdmi to hdmi cable but the connection did not work.  My son suggested that I order a "mini-hdmi to hdmi" cable which I did, and it worked.  I wonder why the need for this kind of cable (mini-hdmi to regular hdmi) is not mentioned in the user manual.  It would satisfy the customer more if this cable is delivered along with the tablet.  With a wide screen and audible volume, I have proven that the tablet is good for streaming movies from Netflix, Amazon Instant Video & Hulu Plus, checking e-mails from my Yahoo & G-Mail.accounts, and playing music collections with the use of micro-sd memory cards.  These are the only functions that I have tried.  I am slowly trying the other aspects, like adding and removing apps, storing and removing data, etc., more comments to follow.  Meantime, I recommend this great tablet to other customers.

Reviews.Title: Love it, am concerned because after only about a month.......
Reviews.Author: Jessie Clem
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love everything about this tablet except one thing.  It is better than expected for the price.  However, after only one month, it is now starting to lock up.  First time, it did so when I was reading a pdf file.  I've only downloaded a few apps.  I also locks up at the login screen.  Might have to do with it updating every time I start up and it asks if I want to close the program or wait for it to respond.  The other day, I started the unit up and walked away for a few moments.  When I came back it was dead.  Couldn't bring it back to life until I depressed the reset button just above the mic.I've worked professionally on Kindle tablets (all models) and now on one model of the Verizon tablet.  And I see the same issues that I'm having  So, I'm still ruling out a mere software issue.  I know code can still be sloppy on all these free apps out there.  So that's where I'm troubleshooting for now.  But, it does leave the thought in my mind that it might just be cheap hardware.  (You get what you pay for, is the saying).As soon as I figure it out.......more to follow.CheersUpdate to Review:  Now 5/28/2014.  Love this tablet.  Turns out that the issues that I was having were entirely software related and due to how many apps were updating on boot.  After resetting to defaults and carefully choosing apps I wanted, now no problems.  Soooo, it was something I did to hose the operating system in the first place.  We also bought another Noria for our daughter.  Both now going strong.  Glad we made the purchases.

Reviews.Title: A piece of Junk!
Reviews.Author: faucet
Reviews.Content: Actually  when I took this out of the box to set it up for my grandson at Christmas I thought it might be a pretty good little tablet for the price.  But I was wrong within 3 weeks the on off button fell off which was part of the mfg warranty - they would only cover if I sent it back to them in China at a tune of $25.00 postage.  In this day and age with all shipping labels being offered on line they couldn't send me a pre-paid  label.....Never again.

Reviews.Title: got ripped off by Seller1on1
Reviews.Author: Edwin R.
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet from Seller1on1, an it didn't work I returned  keep in mind this it was for Xmas. They sent me another one which I received the following Saturday after Xmas I returned it an per Seller1on1 they to me to write on the box "return to sender"  which I did an now they act like they don't know I'm talking about an won't give my money back. They are a bunch of crooks.....

Reviews.Title: Thumbs Down!!
Reviews.Author: ANDREA TABIN
Reviews.Content: Ordered 3 of these tablets for my kids.  Once we took them out of the box we could not get them to connect to WiFi.  It was so disappointing and frustrating.  1 of the tablets did connect for about 5 minutes, but that was about it.  Sent them back the next day.

Reviews.Title: was ok while it worked 20 min
Reviews.Author: Chris Townsend
Reviews.Content: Worked flawless for 20 min then shut offhad to hard reset holding both power and vol buttonand now its locking up again the next dayreturning

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Clemente Vazquez
Reviews.Content: Great gift for the price. Perfect gift for my grandkids. Simple to use they are going to be very happy

Reviews.Title: good for a two year old.
Reviews.Author: Nicki
Reviews.Content: The tablet is good quality. The only problem I have is under the glass is a long piece of hair going across the screen.. for kids this tablet is great , very basic and easy to use.***update****Only day two and with no dropping the screen is on static and won't change.. my daughter is very upset and so am I.*** After trying to get it to die so i can charge it, thinking it might help, i decided to plug it into my laptop (windows 8) and the screen popped up and stated it was debugging.Its working fine now.

Reviews.Title: A Smart Prchase
Reviews.Author: Yvonne R. Gumbs
Reviews.Content: I got it for my 9yr old and she loves it. It does not move as fast as my Kindle Fire, but it works great. When I see my child using it, I try to help her but I dont give it fback and I start playing with it. Now all I need is to purchase 3 more for my other children. Tks, I greatly appreciate this product.

Reviews.Title: chromo inc android tablet
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my mother who is not very tech savy. It was very easy to set up email and skype accounts which are the two items that she will use the most.  It was also very easy to set up the internet connection with a mifi device.  My only trouble with it has been when using the skype function the person on the other end can not hear our part of the conversation.  When I try to find the internal microphone it has been challenging.  Overall satisfied with the tablet for the price it is a great starter for my mother.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: jbarbour
Reviews.Content: I bought these for my 3 kids for Christmas and absolutely love it! I messed around to be able to set up some things and download some games. I have a galaxy tablet and would've been just as happy with this one

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Cathy Savage
Reviews.Content: This product is light but sturdy.  I love it.  It is a little bit sensitive and that can be frustrating for me when I over tap on things.  However, it is fast and doesn't get bogged down when opening apps.  Overall this is a great value for the money and I am very pleased with the product.

Reviews.Title: Nice Inexpensive Tablet
Reviews.Author: J. Williams "Jim Williams"
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these for a friend to surprise her son and boyfriend with for Christmas.  Nice little basic android tablet with a good capacitive touch screen.  Nothing fancy but you would have a hard time beating it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Noria Expanse 10" Android 4.2 Jellybean 8GB Tablet. 1.2Ghz Dual Core...
Reviews.Author: pat
Reviews.Content: Second one defective waiting on response from company. So far they have been very understanding. I am  just frustrated I am disabled so don't get out much this is how I connect with others.I will update when I hear from them.UPDATE Wrote to you yesterday with no reply I'am so frustrated and sadden by all of this I mean 3 in a row  none work right. I either want funds back or Another brand of 10" tablet cause this really sucks.

Reviews.Title: Dont Buy!!!
Reviews.Author: jan
Reviews.Content: I bought my son and grandson one of theses for Christmas. I purchased it November 11, 2013. They opened it on Christmas morning. Since then its been nothing but trouble. It requires a full night charge yet only last maybe an hour playtime. Everytime my son went to get his it needed a charge. Now all of a sudden March 1st, 2014  it wont work period!  I can tell you personally this tablet was not abused...take my advice and dont waste your money!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Tortionist
Reviews.Content: Let's get this out of the way. You get what you pay for. My wife bought this tablet due to the price. I set it up for her which was easy enough. The screen is not very crisp or bright. I put it side by side with my mid range android phone, a Motorola Atrix HD and my Dell Venue 8 tablet. The phone and tablet were much brighter, crisper, and not at all washed out like the Noria tablet. The tablet is sluggish and occasionally freezes. That being said, all of the apps work from the beginning. It does what you'd expect a $72.00 tablet to do and then some. Yes it feels kind of cheap in the hand and has bad battery life. There are a couple of minor positives. It doesn't come with a lot of apps you don't want or need, it takes a micro SD card, and there's at least three different ways of charging it. Did anybody really expect an Asus Transformer tablet for $72.00? If you have issues with it working, then return it and get another one. If it's not up to your expectations then go spend $200.00 + on a tablet you'll enjoy. The Nexus 7  2013 is the top 7 inch tablet in the world. The Asus Transformer tablets just about rule the 10 inch tablet world. For 8 inch you have the Samsung Galaxy Note 8, or if you're slightly more daring and a power user like me, the Dell Venue 8 might strike your fancy, especially at a $200.00 price tag. It runs Android 4.2.2, has 2 GB of RAM, 16 or 32 GB of internal storage, an item atom processor (the kind used in notebooks, netbooks, and even some laptops). It's fast for a Duo core processor at 2 Ghz speed, smooth, and is pretty nice for a midrange tablet. You get a lot of bang for your buck, especially since it's stock Android (without bloat ware or a Dell UI overlay). My only gripe is that the website that sells the Noria retails it for $349.00, even Amazon tries to retail it for $199.00. The most this Noria 7 inch tablet, by Chromo should ever retail for is $99.00, anything higher would be a ripoff. So, in retrospect, $72.00 is a good price, not fantastic, but good. That's approximately a 28%  savings, for all you bargain hunters out there.

Reviews.Title: cheaper alternative
Reviews.Author: John Taulbee
Reviews.Content: Battery does not stay charged very long.  Besides that,  this tablet is great.  Movies appear as if in  HD.  I would recommend this product to a friend

Reviews.Title: Honest review
Reviews.Author: Lucas
Reviews.Content: So I checked out quite a few tablets before buying one. All I needed was a simple one for my daughter to play games and watch videos on. I knew I wasn't getting any top of the line tablet when I purchased it. So knowing the specs on it when i ordered it here's my review:Works for everything I've tried so far, Netflix, hulu, Google play movies, kids games. Picture isn't best but it's a low end resolution I expected with the price. With only 512 ram it takes a little longer to load apps and videos but for less than 60 bucks you get some trade off in speed. With the pre-installed apps you have less than a gig of main storage, there is another 1.4 on the pre-installed nand flash drive. I've pet a 16 gig card full of movies on it and it plays perfect with no lag, just like Netflix and hulu most of the time.The only down sides I didn't know before buying it after looking at the specs was 2 things. First is the battery life. Truly can not make it thru one full movie with out having to put it back on the charger for last part of movie. Lowering the brightness helps but with it being a cheap screen viewing quality goes down. The 2nd is the headset jack. If you put the plug in all the way it plays both through the headphones and the speakers on the tab. About half way in and it only plays on the headphones. Not worth the hassle of returning as headphones aren't used often in my case.For 60 bucks it's hard to say even with the few issues to say it wasn't worth the buy for a tablet for kids or basic needs.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: R. L. Harman
Reviews.Content: But not great either.  You definitely get what you pay for.  I do like that it has an external storage for a micro card so I can use data from other sources.  The bad thing is the processor is very slow, so even with high speed internet the programs are slow to load and everything seems like it runs in slow motion.  Doesn't fit into my teenager's speedy life as well as I wanted it to.

Reviews.Title: poor battery
Reviews.Author: Daleana Richards
Reviews.Content: The battery doesn't last long. The machine keeps reseting itself so you have to reset your settings to your preferences.

Reviews.Title: Great item for kids!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Toso-Kenna
Reviews.Content: I have not personally used this, but both of my kids have one (3 and 4 years old), and they love it! It holds a ton of games, and they are pretty sturdy. This is a great item for the price--I wouldn't expect anything much fancier for $50. I debated buying a Leapster tablet for my kids, but this is way cheaper and good enough quality for them. Plus, as long as it lasts, it will grow with them a little more.

Reviews.Title: Worked for a while
Reviews.Author: Jeanette
Reviews.Content: Ordered 4 of these (one for each person in our house)....3 of the 4 have been returned to do defects.  2 of them the power button became stuck inside, thus could not power up or down.  1 of them would not charge.  Amazon was great about the return and the credit.  However I will not buy this model again, do to the repeated issues.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this model
Reviews.Author: S. D. Miller "S D Miller"
Reviews.Content: I have procrastinated in giving a review and I now can give a more complete review.  This is a piece of trash.  Don't buy it.The battery is barely over 2 hours.  The capacitive is a joke.  It embarrassed me in front of my sister's grandchildren.  The capacitive flat out did not work.  Then later I tried to download an app that required me to do some work online such as putting in my debit card.  The capacitive would not take my tappings, so I ended up not being able to do that.Don't waste your money on this model.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: Andrew Bolda
Reviews.Content: I got two of these for my older sons and they lasted about two months. They no longer charge or turn on. I looked around the web and found it could be that the USB port is poorly made. Many said that they had taken their non charging ones apart and found the charging port had broken off of the main board.I gave it one star, because you need to rate it to write a review.The worst part is I'm past the return date, so I'm out the money. I don't recommend purchasing this item.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for money
Reviews.Author: Maria Trinidad Rivero
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get started in the world of Android and tablets but did not want to spend all my money on it, because basically wanted to browse, read ebooks and work with some applications. I found this tablet and found that gives me the best of these two worlds, is accessible and it suits my requirements. So I bought it and I was right, it works perfectly for me.

Reviews.Title: Broke or something!
Reviews.Author: Gwen Dewease
Reviews.Content: I really Liked the tablet.  The only problem I have is I have written to you about it.  It has a line down the middle (curved) , the next day a second line appeared, as you are looking at it, it would be to the left of it!..I want to send it back...it was a "gift"....it will not come on or anything...please tell me how to go about sending it back, I would like a replacement, please.Thank you for your prompt and kind attention to this problem.Gwen

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: nelson mora
Reviews.Content: so fine, I have bought about 7 in the las two years and I am gonna buy another one in the next days

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: sherria harper
Reviews.Content: this plays extremely low, even when used with headphones. And it stopped working within 2 weeks of having it, the power button went in and didn't come back out.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Lukic
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 11 year old.  It's light and easy for him to use for school and home

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Sonia Friberg
Reviews.Content: The unit would not fully turn on, nor would it turn off.  I returned it as defective.  Amazon.com was very cooperative on the return.

Reviews.Title: not the best
Reviews.Author: Charles E.
Reviews.Content: The tablet is not goodIf you are playing a game (for instance a car game) the car will skip across the screenAnd the tablet fell in half and then snapped back together

Reviews.Title: Noria T2 7" Android Tablet
Reviews.Author: Nana
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet for my grandson who is almost 11 years old. It has plenty of space for the games he wanted downloaded.

Reviews.Title: Would not turn on after one week
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: I opened the box charged the product and checked it could connect to wifi. Barely used it at all and it will not turn on, battery level was fine yesterday, charging does not help, product is completely non functional.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet!
Reviews.Author: William Hogue
Reviews.Content: First off, the tablet has a excellent picture, better than I expected, the games take no time to load nor download. It charges fast and I'm very pleased with the tablet. It has excelled my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Javier cichello
Reviews.Content: I have bought this tablet for my kids and i really believe is very good according the price and quality.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't to happy with this to be honest, just to many issues
Reviews.Author: velly
Reviews.Content: It started great out the box, but after a couple of days use, it began to crash, I know that it's a manufacture error because you don't buy a product, and it's ok, that's just careless thinking. So knowing computers the way I do, became full, I should've went with the samsung tablet.

Reviews.Title: Cheap
Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: The speakers are very quiet, and the camera is absolutely awful. But for the price, you get what you pay for. It's cheap and it does simple things. I wanted a tablet for apps basically, games and social apps. If you want it to listen to music on or to take photos, definite no. But other than that, for just a cheap tablet to play with it's alright.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer

Reviews.Title: Screen stopped working after <60 days
Reviews.Author: Frank Rohm
Reviews.Content: We didn't have high expectations given that we'd never heard of the brand before, but the price was very low so we decided to give it a try. Luckily we bought a Square Trade warranty because there is no mention of a manufacturer's warranty in the paperwork that ships with the product, nor on the manufacturer's web site and it stopped working within 60 days of it being opened and used for the first time.We purchased the item as a Christmas gift. My son used if very gently (and sparingly) between Christmas day and it stopped working before the end of February.My son rates it as a 3 or 4 and enjoyed it while it was working. He was very disappointed when it stopped. So, we're out the shipping and tax and the price of the warranty, but that's it. Happy with the Square Trade, not so happy with Chromo.

Reviews.Title: Chromo Inc review
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: The first impression was usb port on old tablet did not fit this tablet. So can't hook up mouse or keyboard.. The functions work much faster, more smoothly, volume works good, got into apps and worked good.. When first looking at it out of box, noticed a crack in the screen but from closer view, it was a scratch. It had no effect on the product working, so I decided to just keep it verses going through the hassle of shipping back. I than noticed the battery cable not wanting to charge right. My old charger will fit the Chromo Inc too. Old charger is a $49 android tablet made in China. I noticed the charger on Chromo tablet was much cheaper made than the Chinese tablet. The Chinese tablet was a 2.2 tablet, so not nearly as fast, but the Chinese tablet was constructed better. The charging cord works but seems to not make a good connection. On the Chinese tablet, I could charge while viewing the screen, the Chromo tablet does not allow one to view as charging. So what I think is the charger might be the problem. I like the tablet, like I said, very responsive, can maneuver around great.. But anything for $59 is going to have corks. At least it don't freeze up on me..

My buddies at work were amazed at the capabilities and the low price.The device is fairly slippery - so buy a case!  Not sure it will take a drop and survive.JDMc

Reviews.Title: Great value - Chromo Noria Tablet 7 inch
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Emmons "rjemmons"
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet for the price. I highly recommend it as a first tablet for someone who wants to try one without spending a lot, or for a child, etc. I am an engineer and software developer who purchased it because testing new Apps, and fooling around with the Android OS can sometimes crash a tablet, and I'd rather trash a $72 Noria than my $250 Google Nexus 7.It is not really not fair to compare a $72 Noria with a $250 Nexus 7, but the Nexus is the only other tablet I've owned, so I can't seem to help making that comparison. The surprising result is that although the Noria may lose on a direct comparison basis, it doesn't lose by too much, and it definitely wins on bang for the buck.I've had the Noria for about 3 weeks, and I'm very impressed with everything except the display.  The Noria display (800x400) is no where near as vivid and high resolution as the Nexus 7 (1280x800). It is also hard to read at an angle. Nevertheless, it's quite good for $72.Some reviewers have complained about poor battery life for the Noria, but it seems okay to me although I have not done a precise test. Two things that will kill your battery fast are 1) a long sleep delay, and 2) a bright screen setting. When I unboxed my Noria, its factory settings were pretty bad in both these areas. The sleep delay was 30 minutes! The screen was unnecessarily bright. These could be the source of some of the battery life complaints. My Nexus 7 sleep delay was set at 2 minutes at the factory. My Android cell phone was set to 30 seconds. So 30 minutes for a tablet seems way out of line. It will burn some heavy milliamps sitting there doing nothing. I set the Noria sleep delay to 2 minutes. I lowered the screen brightness to about 40%, which seems fine to me. I left the Noria running overight, starting with an 83% charge, and in the morning it had an 82% charge so its sleep power consumption is very low. The Noria battery is rated at 2200 mAh, expected to last 3-4 hours. The Nexus 7 battery is rated at 3950 mAh, expected to last up to 9 hours. So, the Nexus 7 battery  probably lasts twice as long, but we are talking about $72 versus $250. YMMV.Some reviewers have complained about the speed of the Noria, but, again, I do not see a problem. I use a tablet mainly to read books, and check Facebook and Twitter. I rarely play games. For me, the extra $250 - $72 = $178 bought just a little extra speed. When you click an icon on the Noria, there seems to be just a little more delay than you see on the Nexus 7. I think some reviewers may be confused between the speed of a tablet, and the speed of their Internet connection. I saw a YouTube video where someone compared the time that 2 tablets took to install a new App from the Google Play website. This does not measure the speed of the tablets. It measures the time it takes to download the App over your Internet connection plus the time the tablet takes to install the App. In most cases, most of the time is taken by the transfer of the App file over your Internet connection. This can be very variable, and has little to do with the speed of you tablet.I installed and ran the well known "AnTuTu Benchmark" software for Android tablets and phones, available free on Google Play, on both tablets. The Noria scored 9252, described as "Not too bad." The Nexus 7 scored , 13735, described as "Good". For comparison, the Samsung Galaxy Note3 scored about 35,000, the Samsung Galaxy 4 about 25,000, the Samsung Galaxy S3 about 17,000, the Samsung Galaxy S2 about 10,000.The Noria has both front (0.3mp) and back (2mp) facing cameras. The Nexus 7 only has one front facing camera (1.2mp). The Noria has an HDMI connector the Nexus 7 has none. The Noria has 8GB flash memory, my Nexus 7 has 32GB. But ... the Noria has a micro SD card slot which can expand the memory to 32GB, and you can get a 32GB micro SD card for $20 if you find you need it. SD card memory can be somewhat less convenient to use than the internal RAM. The Noria connected to my home WIFI with no problem, and re-connects perfectly each time I turn it on. I have no problem downloading Apps or surfing the net. The Noria connected to my Windows 7 computer via USB with no problem. I have no problem transferring files between the computer and the tablet.If you're looking for bang for the buck, it is hard to beat the Noria.

Reviews.Title: Perfect kid tablet but don't get this if you are planing on using the camera.

With this you can download lots of educational games for free with high quality. Some games support the gsensor function, which you can turn/tilt the device to steer or navigate. I've downloaded a few flight games with great reviews that's crashing while loading, I'm researching on to why this is happening but the other games working great. The camera is horrible, do not get this if you're planing on using it to take pictures (guess this is a good thing to prevent kids from taking certain pictures). Surprised that many reviewers aren't mentioning how bad the camera is. If you have fast connection downloads are super fast. Don't get this if you've had a kindle, Samsung, apple tablet.. You will be dissapointed. Can also put downloaded movies on here that plays with no lag. The picture isn't bad. I'm giving this 5 stars as a kid tablet.

Reviews.Title: grandson
Reviews.Author: Susan Mayhan
Reviews.Content: My grandson loves this tablet. I think it would be a nice one for adults if it were a little larger. But he loves it and the price was great.

Reviews.Title: Reasonable value for the price
Reviews.Author: vit
Reviews.Content: I m fine with this device except the fact that battery keeps much less than what is written in the product description. Quite usual issue with tablets.My real rating would be 3.5 which is not possible here.

Reviews.Title: Mysterious cracks
Reviews.Author: D. W. Butler "Silly Philosopher and Alchemist"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for my adult sons. The first one developed a crack within a week and the other in about 2 months. In both cases there was no clear reason, such as a drop, for the cracks. Worked fine before the cracks but it wouldn't matter if they were better than iPads if you can't use them due to the defect.

Reviews.Title: Improvements needed
Reviews.Author: sherene M
Reviews.Content: Decent product. I ordered colours blue and black they sent me only black. One is working just fine the other does not. One started giving problems the same day I received them and I hate returning purchases. After all I ordered NEW PRODUCTS. However price wasn't too bad

Reviews.Title: My candy crush game on Facebook.
Reviews.Author: Patricia Pickett
Reviews.Content: I keep loosing service and it is extremely slow even though I have high speed internet.  On my candy crush from Sega I lose games and cannot get the screen to react to send lives.  I have to hiut the screen at least 10 times.

Reviews.Title: Very good for small children's use.
Reviews.Author: KathrynR
Reviews.Content: Good for small children's use. They are easy to use and have enough room to add games and learning programs. Thanks

Reviews.Title: My 1st Tablet
Reviews.Author: TP
Reviews.Content: I chose this particular Tablet because I am very familiar with Android and I love it. Also I researched the features and apps it could download. I went to the stores and compared the pricing which online AMAZON has frequently beat. The JellyBean itself is light weight, touch screen feature is precise, clarity of screen is great for pics & its compact.

Reviews.Title: Four Hours is Four Hours - No More- Maybe Less!
Reviews.Author: Leon De Vose, II "Pursuing the Character of J...
Reviews.Content: I had just bought my Bride a Galaxy S3.  This is when I realized how handy a tablet could be.  I decided to try these out.I could tell you more if I used it more.  It is not that I do not try to use it.  It is just that the battery starts running down from the time I take it off the charger.  Four hours is four hours!  No more, maybe less.  If I use it during the four hours, it runs down.  If I just carry it around for four hours, it runs down.  Four hours is four hours - no more -maybe less.I should have payed attention to the "GAMING TABLET" description.I am 50+ in grad school, and could put this to great use.  However, four hours - you know!

Reviews.Title: Good deal and it is the same with the white one.
Reviews.Author: Giovalina Paredes
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheap and good tablet, this is adequate for you. This works with android 4.1 and it is fast enough. Chromo Inc 7 Tab Pc is not a known brand mark. However, it is worthy and the price and value is very good!.

Reviews.Content: I SEND IT BACK BECAUSE IT NOT WORKING GOOD I AM STILL WAITING FOR A NEXT ONE IF YOU CAN NOT SEND ME BACK ONE PLEASE GIVE ME BACK MY MONEY  THANKS YOU .

Reviews.Title: any other reviews
Reviews.Author: justice ankomah
Reviews.Content: am willing to purchase this tabletif there can be any reviews from previous purchasesfor me to know how good it isif any one can tell me from their experience details of this this tab then I will buy it right

Reviews.Title: its ok
Reviews.Author: Francheska Milano
Reviews.Content: Hi, I just did 4 stars because they are smaller than what i though i would be. I bought 2 for my mom and my dad and it's ok for them because they do not like big tablets. You can get online, dowonload our favorites apps.. it's good for people who dont use too much.

Reviews.Title: noria 7" 8gb tablet pc
Reviews.Author: L. Sackett "music/movie"
Reviews.Content: this is great for my toddler. easier for him to hold than an ipad. hdmi cable makes it easier to store his movies on and dont have him ruining the actual disc.

ProductInfo.Features:
The NORIA T2 features the fastest in its category Dual Core CPU with top speeds at 1.2 GHz and 8GB of integrated flash memory HD which all lend to a faster responsive experience.
The Noria T2 is capable of being used as a dedicated Chromecast Controller
5 point Multi Touch feature means you can expand and minimize content seamlessly using the Android JellyBean 4.1 Software. Dual integrated front and rear facing cameras work GREAT as a webcam with SKYPE (pre-installed)/Google Video call as well as recording video and pictures in multiple settings
This tablet allows you to stream video on and HD 16:9 Display directly from the pre installed Google Chrome browser, Netflix App and all other streaming websites as well as download apps from Google Play Store over fast Wifi 802.11b/g/n.
Mini HDMI connects the NORIA T2 to your TV screen giving you a full internet streaming experience . Bonus HDMI Cable Included.
ProductInfo.Name: NORIA T2 7" Android JellyBean Tablet PC - Multi Touch. 8GB Flash Local Memory. HDMI Port (Bonus HDMI Cable Included). Dual Core CPU. Integrated Dual Camera 2MP - Black - September 2013.
